title: #ORUMGOLF Ranked 2nd, Liljeberg Named to Summit League Watch List
text:
#ORUMGOLF Ranked 2nd, Liljeberg Named to Summit League Watch List
The Oral Roberts men's golf team has been ranked second in the Summit League's Preseason Poll, with sophomore Gustav Liljeberg earning a spot on the Preseason Watch List. North Dakota State topped the poll with 97 points and eight first-place votes, while Oral Roberts garnered 89 points and two first-place votes. South Dakota State, the reigning champions Kansas City, and St. Thomas followed, rounding out the top five. The upcoming championship will take place in April, and Oral Roberts aims for its first title since 2010.
- North Dakota State received 97 points and 8 first-place votes.
- Oral Roberts scored 89 points with 2 first-place votes.
- South Dakota State finished third with 81 points.
- The Summit League consists of 11 teams, with the addition of Northern Colorado and Weber State this season.
- The team has set its sights on winning the championship, last achieved in 2010.
The teams will compete in the Summit League Championship in April, where Oral Roberts will seek to reclaim its title. As the season progresses, match performances will be critical in determining their readiness for the championship.
Bottom LineThe Oral Roberts men's golf team is poised for a competitive season, backed by a strong preseason ranking and the talent of players like Gustav Liljeberg; success in upcoming matches will be vital to their championship aspirations.
Read more at Oral Roberts University
